paragraphs: Combustion is a chemical process in which a substance reacts with oxygen to give off heat.
Light is also produced during combustion.
activities: Burning a candle to observe the different zones of flame.
diagrams: Diagram of candle flame with labeled zones
questions: Why is oxygen necessary for combustion?
box_facts: Combustion is always accompanied by heat and light.

paragraphs: Rapid combustion happens when a substance burns quickly with the production of heat and light.
Spontaneous combustion occurs without external ignition.
activities: Observe rapid combustion using spirit lamp.
Demonstrate spontaneous combustion using white phosphorus.
questions: Explain rapid and spontaneous combustion with examples.
